thread.title: Arkansas-Auburn went 4 OTs, and Lolo Jones threw some shade
thread.title_full: Arkansas-Auburn went 4 OTs, and Lolo Jones threw some shade

title: Arkansas-Auburn went 4 OTs, and Lolo Jones threw some shade
text:
By Clinton Yates October 24 at 4:42 PM Follow @clintonyates Arkansas’ Jeremiah Ledbetter (55) celebrates after sacking Auburn’s quarterback during the first half an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Fayetteville, Ark. (AP Photo/Samantha Baker) 
Can’t say we expected Arkansas vs. Auburn to turn into the best game of the early slate, but after a four-overtime thriller that the Razorbacks pulled out, 54-46, it appears to be so. The SEC West battle in Fayetteville, Ark., even got the attention of an Olympian. Superb! Kerryon Johnson. Prime lead leg. Trail leg snaps down. Would've gave A+ but he didn't run much off hurdle.A- pic.twitter.com/IjpJ18D4jv 
— Lolo Jones (@lolojones) October 24, 2015 
That was the best play of the day, in the best game of the day so far. But Lolo Jones gets an ‘F’ for criticizing a kid who’s hurdling a player at full speed with a bunch of other guys trying to rip his head off. Clinton Yates is a D.C. native and an online columnist. When he's not covering the city, pop culture or listening to music, he watches sports. A lot of them. sports Success! Check your inbox for details.
